definitions: loose draped garment worn by citizens in ancient Rome
examples: The senator wore his toga to the Roman forum proceedings
Students dressed in togas for the ancient history presentation

definitions: switch that alternates between two states or positions
cylindrical button passed through a loop for fastening
examples: Click the toggle switch to turn the lights on
The software toggle allows switching between different viewing modes
Her winter coat fastened with wooden toggle buttons
The duffle coat had distinctive toggle fastenings

definitions: exhausting physical labor or continuous difficult work
examples: Years of toil in the fields aged him prematurely
The manuscript represented months of intellectual toil

definitions: plumbing fixture for disposing of human waste and flushing
process of washing, dressing, and grooming oneself
examples: The plumber fixed the broken toilet in the bathroom
Public toilets are located near the park entrance
She spent an hour at her morning toilet before work
His daily toilet included shaving and styling his hair

definitions: physical object used as substitute for money or access
digital unit representing value in cryptocurrency or gaming systems
small sign or gesture indicating something larger
examples: She inserted a token into the subway turnstile
The arcade required tokens instead of quarters for games
He bought several tokens during the cryptocurrency market dip
Game tokens can be earned through completing daily challenges
She gave him a token of her appreciation
The flowers were merely a token gesture of apology

definitions: willingness to accept different beliefs, behaviors, or opinions without judgment
permissible limit of variation in measurement or specification
examples: Religious tolerance promotes peaceful coexistence in diverse communities
She showed great tolerance for her noisy neighbors
The machine parts have a tolerance of plus or minus two millimeters
Manufacturing tolerance must be precise for aerospace components

definitions: practice or policy of permitting beliefs or behaviors one disagrees with
examples: The Act of Toleration granted religious freedom to nonconformists
His toleration of dissent strengthened democratic principles

definitions: fee charged for using a road, bridge, or tunnel
number of deaths or casualties from disaster or conflict
slow regular ringing of a bell especially for death
examples: Drivers must pay a toll to cross the bridge
Electronic toll collection speeds up highway traffic
The earthquake's death toll exceeded one thousand victims
War takes a heavy toll on civilian populations
The church bell's toll announced the funeral service
Bells tolled solemnly throughout the mourning period

definitions: structure where tolls are collected from vehicles on highways
examples: Cars lined up at the tollbooth during rush hour
The old tollbooth was replaced with electronic collection systems

definitions: adult male domestic cat especially an unneutered one
adult male turkey used especially for breeding
examples: The neighborhood tom prowled the alleys at night
Our tom cat marked his territory around the garden
The turkey farm kept several toms for breeding purposes
A wild tom strutted displaying his tail feathers

definitions: light axe used as tool and weapon by Native Americans
examples: The museum displayed a ceremonial tomahawk with intricate carvings
Warriors carried tomahawks for both combat and utility purposes

definitions: round red fruit eaten as vegetable in salads and cooking
examples: She sliced fresh tomatoes for the salad
The garden produced abundant tomatoes this summer

definitions: vault or chamber for burying the dead, often elaborate
examples: Archaeologists discovered the pharaoh's tomb intact after millennia
The family tomb held generations of ancestors

definitions: girl who enjoys activities and behaviors traditionally associated with boys
examples: As a tomboy, she preferred climbing trees to playing with dolls
The tomboy joined the boys' soccer team enthusiastically

definitions: stone slab or monument marking a grave with inscriptions
examples: The weathered tombstone bore dates from the eighteenth century
Fresh flowers adorned the tombstone on Memorial Day

definitions: unneutered adult male cat especially one that roams freely
examples: The old tomcat fought other males for territory
That tomcat sprays to mark his domain

definitions: large heavy book typically scholarly or containing extensive information
examples: The ancient tome contained centuries of accumulated wisdom
She struggled to carry the weighty legal tome

definitions: unit of weight equal to 2000 pounds in US
informal expression meaning a very large quantity
examples: The truck can haul ten tons of gravel
Shipping costs increase significantly per ton
She has tons of homework to complete tonight
That mistake cost the company tons of money

definitions: organization of music around a central note or tonal center creating hierarchy
examples: The composer shifted tonality from major to minor dramatically
Jazz musicians often experiment with ambiguous tonality

definitions: quality or character of sound especially voice or instrument
general emotional atmosphere or attitude in communication
degree of firmness and strength in muscles or skin
particular shade or quality of color
examples: Her tone of voice revealed hidden disappointment
The violin's tone resonated beautifully in the hall
The meeting took on a serious tone after the announcement
His email had an unnecessarily aggressive tone
Regular exercise improves muscle tone throughout the body
Good skin tone indicates healthy circulation
The artist mixed several tones of blue for the seascape
Warm tones dominated the autumn landscape painting

definitions: fine powder used in laser printers and photocopiers for printing
liquid cosmetic that cleanses and tightens facial skin
examples: The printer needs new toner cartridge to continue printing
Black toner ran out during the important presentation
She applied toner after cleansing her face each night
This toner helps minimize the appearance of pores

definitions: muscular organ in mouth used for tasting and speaking
particular language or dialect spoken by a group
flap of material under shoe laces
examples: The doctor examined her swollen tongue for infection
He burned his tongue on the hot coffee
English is her mother tongue though she speaks three languages
The ancient tongue survived only in religious texts
Pull the tongue forward before lacing your boots
The shoe's padded tongue provides extra comfort

definitions: medicinal substance taken to restore health and vigor
carbonated water containing quinine used in mixed drinks
first note of a musical scale establishing the key
examples: The herbal tonic promised to boost energy naturally
Victorian pharmacies sold various health tonics
He ordered gin and tonic with a slice of lime
Tonic water glows under ultraviolet light due to quinine
The melody returns to the tonic for resolution
In C major, C is the tonic note

definitions: carrying capacity of a ship measured in tons
total weight of goods measured in tons
examples: The vessel's tonnage determines port fees and regulations
Larger tonnage ships require deeper harbor channels
Annual tonnage through the port exceeded projections significantly
Coal tonnage declined as renewable energy increased

definitions: metric unit of mass equal to 1000 kilograms
examples: The shipment weighed exactly five tonnes
Carbon emissions are measured in tonnes per year

definitions: device or implement used to carry out particular function
computer program that performs specific task
something used as means to accomplish purpose
examples: The carpenter selected the right tool for each task
Power tools require proper safety equipment
This debugging tool helps identify code errors quickly
Photo editing tools enhance image quality
Education serves as a tool for social mobility
Language is humanity's most powerful tool

definitions: box or chest for storing and carrying tools
collection of skills, methods, or resources available
examples: He carried his red metal toolbox to the work site
The toolbox contained everything needed for basic repairs
Teachers need a diverse toolbox of instructional strategies
Add meditation to your stress management toolbox

definitions: animated cartoon character especially in film or television
large tropical tree valued for its timber
examples: Classic toons like Bugs Bunny remain popular today
The movie mixed live action with animated toons
Toon wood is prized for furniture making in Asia
The toon tree grows rapidly in tropical climates

definitions: short blast of a horn or similar sound
examples: The train gave a loud toot before departing
She heard the car's friendly toot outside

definitions: hard white structure in mouth used for biting and chewing
projection on gear wheel or saw blade
examples: The dentist extracted her wisdom tooth carefully
Children lose baby teeth as permanent teeth grow
The gear tooth broke under excessive pressure
Saw teeth must be sharpened regularly

definitions: pain in or around a tooth usually from decay or infection
examples: Her toothache kept her awake all night
Severe toothache requires immediate dental attention

definitions: small brush with handle for cleaning teeth
examples: Electric toothbrushes remove plaque more effectively than manual ones
Replace your toothbrush every three months

definitions: paste or gel used with toothbrush for cleaning teeth
examples: Fluoride toothpaste helps prevent tooth decay
She squeezed toothpaste onto her brush

definitions: highest or uppermost point, surface, or part of something
piece of clothing covering the upper body
toy that spins on its pointed end
highest degree, amount, or intensity
examples: She reached the top of the mountain at sunset
The book sat on top of the stack
She wore a red top with blue jeans
Summer tops should be light and breathable
Children played with colorful spinning tops
The wooden top spun for several minutes
He performed at the top of his ability
Sales reached their top last quarter

definitions: hard transparent or translucent mineral used as a gemstone typically yellow
examples: Her engagement ring featured a blue topaz center stone
Imperial topaz displays rich golden orange color

definitions: art of clipping shrubs or trees into ornamental shapes
examples: The garden featured elaborate topiary animals and geometric forms
Topiary requires patience and skilled pruning techniques

definitions: subject of discussion, writing, or study
examples: Climate change dominated the conference topics
She chose an interesting topic for her research paper

definitions: arrangement of natural and artificial physical features of an area
examples: The map showed detailed topography including elevation changes
Mountainous topography affects local weather patterns significantly

definitions: person who achieves the highest score or rank
decorative item placed on top of something especially cake
formal top hat or similar headwear
examples: She was the topper in her graduating class
The exam topper received a scholarship
The wedding cake topper depicted the bride and groom
Birthday cake toppers come in various themes
He wore a silk topper to the formal event
Victorian gentlemen favored tall toppers

definitions: sauce, garnish, or other food put on top of another food
examples: Pizza toppings included pepperoni and mushrooms
Ice cream toppings ranged from hot fudge to sprinkles

definitions: sail set above the lowest sail on a square-rigged mast
examples: Sailors furled the topsail as winds increased dangerously
The ship's topsail caught the morning breeze perfectly

definitions: upper deck or above-deck area of a ship
lean cut of beef from the inner thigh
examples: Passengers gathered topside to watch the sunset
The captain ordered all hands topside immediately
She braised the topside slowly for Sunday dinner
Topside makes excellent roast beef when properly cooked

definitions: uppermost layer of soil containing organic matter and nutrients
examples: Erosion stripped away valuable topsoil from the fields
Gardeners added fresh topsoil to improve plant growth

definitions: high rocky hill or peak especially on moorland
examples: Hikers climbed the granite tor for panoramic views
Ancient tors dotted the desolate moorland landscape

definitions: portable light source with flame on a stick
battery-powered portable electric light especially in British English
examples: Olympic runners carry the torch between host cities
Medieval castles were lit by burning torches
She used a torch to find her way in the dark
Keep a torch in your car for emergencies

definitions: light produced by a torch or torches
examples: The procession moved through streets lit only by torchlight
They explored the cave by torchlight

definitions: past tense of tear meaning ripped or moved quickly
examples: She accidentally tore the important document
The car tore down the highway at dangerous speeds

definitions: severe physical or mental suffering and anguish
examples: His guilty conscience became a constant torment
The prisoner endured physical torment during captivity

definitions: violently rotating column of air extending from thunderstorm to ground
examples: The tornado destroyed hundreds of homes in minutes
Tornado warnings sent residents rushing to storm shelters

definitions: self-propelled underwater explosive weapon launched from submarine or ship
examples: The submarine fired two torpedoes at the enemy vessel
World War II torpedoes revolutionized naval warfare
